title: 305-B
statement: B. Continued Fractionstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutA continued fraction of heightnis a fraction of form. You are given two rational numbers, one is represented asand the other one is represented as a finite fraction of heightn. Check if they are equal.InputThe first line contains two space-separated integersp,q(1 ≤q≤p≤ 1018)— the numerator and the denominator of the first fraction.The second line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 90)— the height of the second fraction. The third line containsnspace-separated integersa1,a2, ...,an(1 ≤ai≤ 1018)— the continued fraction.Please, do not use the%lldspecifier to read or write 64-bit integers in С++. It is preferred to use thecin,coutstreams or the%I64dspecifier.OutputPrint "YES" if these fractions are equal and "NO" otherwise.ExamplesInput9 422 4OutputYESInput9 432 3 1OutputYESInput9 431 2 4OutputNONoteIn the first sample.In the second sample.In the third sample.

processed.result:
You are given two rational numbers. The first is represented as a fraction $\frac{p}{q}$. The second is represented as a continued fraction of height $n$:

$$
a_1 + \frac{1}{a_2 + \frac{1}{a_3 + \frac{1}{... + \frac{1}{a_n}}}}
$$

Determine if the two fractions are equal.

**Input:**

* Line 1: Two integers $p$ and $q$ (1 ≤ q ≤ p ≤ 10<sup>18</sup>), the numerator and denominator of the first fraction.
* Line 2: An integer $n$ (1 ≤ n ≤ 90), the height of the continued fraction.
* Line 3: $n$ integers $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$ (1 ≤ $a_i$ ≤ 10<sup>18</sup>), the coefficients of the continued fraction.

**Output:**

Print "YES" if the fractions are equal, and "NO" otherwise.

You are given two fractions. The first fraction is represented by two numbers (numerator and denominator). The second fraction is represented by a sequence of numbers. Determine if the two fractions are equal.
